name: Kung Pao Tofu
description: If you like Chinese food, you should really this sweet, salty, and spicy Kung Pao tofu. It takes less than 30 minutes to make and it's such a great weeknight dinner!
recipeIngredient: 2  cloves of garlic, minced or finely chopped

recipeInstructions.text: Cut the tofu into cubes and put it in a bowl. Add two tablespoons of corn starch. Make sure all cubes are covered in corn starch.
recipeInstructions.name: Cut the tofu into cubes and put it in a bowl. Add two tablespoons of corn starch. Make sure all cubes are covered in corn starch.

recipeInstructions.text: Cut the green onions into rings and finely chop the garlic and the ginger.
recipeInstructions.name: Cut the green onions into rings and finely chop the garlic and the ginger.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat some sesame oil in a large pan. Cook until lightly browned and crispy.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat some sesame oil in a large pan. Cook until lightly browned and crispy.

recipeInstructions.text: In the meantime, make the sauce. Place all ingredients in a small bowl and stir until combined.
recipeInstructions.name: In the meantime, make the sauce. Place all ingredients in a small bowl and stir until combined.

recipeInstructions.text: Once the tofu is crispy, set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Once the tofu is crispy, set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat some more sesame oil in the same pan and add the garlic, the ginger, and half of the green onions. Cook for 2 minutes on medium heat. Stir constantly.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat some more sesame oil in the same pan and add the garlic, the ginger, and half of the green onions. Cook for 2 minutes on medium heat. Stir constantly.

recipeInstructions.text: Then add the remaining green onions and the bell pepper and cook for 5 minutes. Stir a few times. Then add the tofu, the peanuts, and the sauce and stir carefully. Season with red pepper flakes. Cook for 3-5 minutes until the sauce thickens.
recipeInstructions.name: Then add the remaining green onions and the bell pepper and cook for 5 minutes. Stir a few times. Then add the tofu, the peanuts, and the sauce and stir carefully. Season with red pepper flakes. Cook for 3-5 minutes until the sauce thickens.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve the kung pao tofu with rice and sprinkle with more green onions.
